title: Unjustified ban after being forced onto an off role in NORMALS?
body:
I was banned for "intentional feeding" in NORMALS when I was forced onto the jungle role (I only play ADC or support and in that game our bot lane was a duo). I didn't do well because I was first time jungle and the enemy Evelyn counter jungled me a lot, and then my team reported me and I got banned for it.

Ban message for the game I "inted"

https://i.imgur.com/DubGIdn.png

As you can see, only 1 game was listed, which was the off role game. 

Game that I "inted"

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/188038691/2611039?tab=overview

As shown in the stats, even though I died quite a lot, I had assists, jungle creeps, and kills, and battle participation. I was not running down mid, I was trying my best to learn the role.

I don't int, not in that game, nor have I inted in previous games. 

I've never had a warning this whole season, so an immediate 14 day ban with rewards stripped seems excessive.

UPDATE: Riot has reviewed my case and removed my suspension. However, my honor level still shows "dishonorable" and unable to receive end of season rewards.

I've continued correspondence and hopefully I can get the whole suspension reversed so I can get my ranked rewards this season.

UPDATE 3: Riot has said they restored my honor level, however it still shows as level 0 dishonored..

replies.body:
Hi Cromat,

Seras is right that a support ticket is your best bet here. I can see that you submitted one earlier today. Support queues are a little backed up at the moment due to worlds, emotes, end of season rewards and new ban systems coming around all at the same time, so it may take a while for them to reach you.

We're trying to increase the effectiveness of our feeding detection system, and regrettably this means some false positives as we increase the system's aggression. If it is determined that this was a false positive in your case, you'll get your ban reversed.
Thanks, I'm glad that I got any official response to this. Hopefully I can get my ban reversed.

Update 2: Everything seems to be fixed. My honor is back, and they said I will be eligible for rewards.

I know it probably isn't said often, but thanks Riot support OCE!

EDIT: just went into my account. Still dishonored and level 0...

It may take a bit longer for the Honour level to be restored to its original value. Was Player Support able to adjust the level, or is it still showing 0? If you're still having issues, I can pass a note along to the Player Support team.
sorry for the late reply. honor has been fixed
Ah, fantastic. Cheers, and let me know if you ever need anything else! :)

Update: Riot has reviewed my case and removed my suspension. However, my honor level still shows "dishonorable" and unable to receive end of season rewards.

I've continued correspondence and hopefully I can get the whole suspension reversed so I can get my ranked rewards this season.

https://i.imgur.com/vCkmrdv.png

Not a bad response time given they are getting flooded with requests at the moment.

I'm glad that you have been an unfair ban lifted. Thanks for sharing with us. 

Good luck getting ranked rewards back, I hope they do now that they have lifted the ban.

Having kills, assists and CS doesn't necessarily mean you aren't inting, I've seen people get 15 kills before deciding they're done and running it down mid, but of course we can't see that unless you saved a replay or something.

You got a 14 day straight up because it's the first punishment tier that applies to intent feeding. A chat restriction doesn't make much sense as a punishment for feeding does it?

As to your individual case, if you really weren't intent feeding then send a ticket through to player support and they can take another look at your game. It's rare that people get false bans so forgive any scepticism, but they do happen. Assuming you are innocent, support is your best approach here.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=9jEYVnjY,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-10-10T08:45:30.675+0000)
>
> Having kills, assists and CS doesn't necessarily mean you aren't inting, I've seen people get 15 kills before deciding they're done and running it down mid, but of course we can't see that unless you saved a replay or something.

This is a ridiculous example of riot punishing a player for trying to learn a champ. There should be statistics to suggest that someone is inting in the game. It should be a pretty easy to see through stats like if the player is dying and not getting any other team assisting statistics (or hardly).

There are stats that show that, just not ones we can see. KDA, KP, CS, that kind of thing aren't very helpful in some cases of intent feeding (usually the kind that starts part way through a game, or if someone is just having a really bad game). I haven't yet heard of a false intent feeding ban, but in the spirit of innocent until proven guilty I gave OP the best advice I could assuming it is a false ban, namely to submit a ticket about it.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=9jEYVnjY,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-10T23:32:58.787+0000)
>
> There are stats that show that, just not ones we can see. KDA, KP, CS, that kind of thing aren't very helpful in some cases of intent feeding (usually the kind that starts part way through a game, or if someone is just having a really bad game). I haven't yet heard of a false intent feeding ban, but in the spirit of innocent until proven guilty I gave OP the best advice I could assuming it is a false ban, namely to submit a ticket about it.

Those are not very helpful? So basically the ban is justified if multiple people report a person because they get angry because one of their team mates died a lot? Well, if that's how you suggest it's working. It seems like we have to re-define intentional feeding. Those statistics can be very helpful, even the ones we cannot see, and maybe it's the ones that we cannot see along with chat logs to help determine intentional feeding before banning a player for 14 days, not just take the untrained and unprofessional opinion of other players. You say you haven't heard of a false intent feeding ban. I'm surprise you haven't if this is the way it's being handled.

Not what I was saying. I am saying the limited stats we can see player side are not really enough to tell if a player was intent feeding or not. Riot has access to much more info from games that is plenty to determine intent.

I was only saying the player side stats aren't very helpful. Sometimes it's obvious from our end, and other times it's not. It isn't based solely on reports, that would not be a good way of doing things.
Quite right. It is very complicated.
you can check my heat map. i died within my own jungle due to enemy invading, and whenever i tried to gank a lane.

While heatmaps do give us more info, they still don't really prove anything. We can't see things like actions taken leading up to/during your death for example. You really need a combo of stats to know with any certainty.

> [{quoted}](name=cromat,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=9jEYVnjY,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2017-10-11T01:58:25.259+0000)
>
> you can check my heat map. i died within my own jungle due to enemy invading, and whenever i tried to gank a lane.

If that's the case, obviously just outplayed.

> [{quoted}](name=The Dark Lörd,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=9jEYVnjY,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-10-10T22:36:59.961+0000)
>
> This is a ridiculous example of riot punishing a player for trying to learn a champ. There should be statistics to suggest that someone is inting in the game. It should be a pretty easy to see through stats like if the player is dying and not getting any other team assisting statistics (or hardly).

I'd also like to point out that people use that as an excuse so they don't get banned for inting. Over the past few days i've had inters blatantly inting and then typing in chat to the enemy team saying their "learning" a new champ and of course they get banned because they really aren't learning anything.

Sadly only Riot/Support are the only ones that know for sure whether or not a person is inting or not. Im sure all bans are verified before being handed down.

There are several factors that should be taken into account to determine intentional feeding. Maybe when a player is not playing so well in a norm game and they say they are learning a new champion, then it would extremely assumptive to say they are inting.

There also can be a fine line between being tilted and inting which needs to be determined before banning someone.

I'm also glad that Riot are the only ones that can determine for sure if someone is inting or not. I'd rather such decisions in their hands than the hands of an unprofessional subjective set of opinions backed up by anger and ill reason. I just wish it was handled better.

> [{quoted}](name=The Dark Lörd,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=9jEYVnjY,comment-id=0000000000010000,timestamp=2017-10-11T09:26:46.605+0000)
>
> There are several factors that should be taken into account to determine intentional feeding. Maybe when a player is not playing so well in a norm game and they say they are learning a new champion, then it would extremely assumptive to say they are inting.
> 
> There also can be a fine line between being tilted and inting which needs to be determined before banning someone.
> 
> I'm also glad that Riot are the only ones that can determine for sure if someone is inting or not. I'd rather such decisions in their hands than the hands of an unprofessional subjective set of opinions backed up by anger and ill reason. I just wish it was handled better.

I agree for the most part, but I beg to differ on the tilted part. Just because you're tilted doesn't give you the right to int in a game. In fact, if a player is tilted then they shouldn't be playing at all, it's not just your game you're ruining its 9 others as well.

As I said, its for Riot to determine and verify who and who isn't feeding and im sure the ban was justified.

I'm not supporting inting by any means, indeed it should be banned. My concern is that inting needs to be determined correctly before banning someone. I agree that players should not be playing if they are tilted, but it's not uncommon for players to enter a game feeling OK and then get tilted halfway through. It does not mean they are inting, it just means they are having a bad game, and players should not be banned for just having a bad game.

Indeed it is up to Riot, but If you're so sure the ban is justified, maybe you can back that up before making those sorts of statements? It's offensive to make assumptive accusations, otherwise. It would be fairer to remain neutral to the situation. He's already come back advising us that he has had his ban lifted. That comment just makes you look like a dick now. :P
